pullRequest.title: Jwe consumer fat 1
pullRequest.bodyText:
Deliver the JWE Consumer FATs along with a few updates to the builder (1) review comments, (2) constant changes that affected builder and consumer.
#13577
#build
#spawn.fullfat.buckets=com.ibm.ws.security.jwtsso_fat,com.ibm.ws.security.jwt_fat.builder,com.ibm.ws.security.jwt_fat.consumer,com.ibm.ws.security.mp.jwt.1.1_fat,com.ibm.ws.security.mp.jwt.1.2_fat

commit.message:
Issue 13577: JWE consumer support initial drop

For issue #13577

Adds support for server.xml configuration attributes that allow consuming of JWE tokens.
Issue 13577: Add doPriv in JWT consumer and Sensitive annotation for JWE decrypt keys
Update to allow consumer client to handle bad tokens

nodes.bodyText: Looks like a redundant if check here.

This is a scenario I'm going to have to think about. At the moment we'll go ahead and try to decrypt a JWE regardless of what the consumer's configuration says (i.e. they may not have keyManagementKeyAlias set). This scenario shows that we'll end up trying to use some default key in the server-wide keystore. As we've been talking about, https://github.com/eclipse/microprofile-jwt-auth/blob/master/spec/src/main/asciidoc/configuration.asciidoc#requirements-for-accepting-signed-and-encrypted-tokens suggests that we shouldn't accept JWEs in the case where the mp.jwt.decrypt.key.location MP Config property (or, in our case, the keyManagementKeyAlias config attribute) isn't set.
I may very well add a new message for this scenario.
